results.title: Butterfly
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “1976-1980 Olympic & world class swimmers”.
One of a series of films which shows swimmers, and their styles and techniques. Slow motion is used to clarify the demonstrations. This film concentrates on butterfly swimming. Swimmers featured include Mike Bruner, Steve Gregg and Joe Bottom.

results.title: Office Supervisor's Problems
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: The Self made man
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisors Problem”

Provides supervisors of office personnel with a dramatised case history that will stimulate discussion of the factors that lead to successful self development. Based on actual experience, the supervisors can identify themselves with the problem.

results.title: Promotion by-pass
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problems”.
The office manager has been called on to make a recommendation for promotion and decides on a younger employee because of his ability to get on with people. The older man who has been with the company for fifteen years is passed over. He is disgruntled and resigns although the supervisor tries to explain the situation to him. Discussion is on the question of whether the office manager was right to make the decision that he did.

results.title: The Missing interest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problem”.
A dramatised case problem which can lead to searching discussion of methods of developing employee involvement and interest in low level narrow scope jobs. Supervisors can identify and project themselves into the situation. The film poses but does not answer a basic problem.

results.title: In the middle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problems”.
The supervisor in order to avoid getting rid of staff when work is slack arranged for a transfer of his best typist to another section. Unfortunately he neglects to explain to her why he has recommended the transfer and she thinks it is because he considers her work to be poor. She complains to his superior officer, which causes trouble for the supervisor. Discussion is on how the situation could have been avoided.
results.description:

results.title: How much cooperation?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problems”.
A discussion-provoking film about employer and employee office cooperation. A supervisor returns from an out of town trip with a rush job. He speaks to the staff about it and promises to have it ready so they won’t have to work back on it.

results.title: The Grapevine
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problems”.
Two girls discuss of rumour that they have heard that their company is merging with another company which would mean moving to another city. On another occasion new office equipment is obtained and the rumour is spread that girls are being replaced by machines. The office manager when confronted with the stories says there is no truth in them. He has not been generous in answering questions and they were nervous about going to him. The question for discuss is how rumour can be prevented from being started.

results.title: The Follow through (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problem”.
An office force is distressed because some important reports have failed to get through. It is found that the fault lay in the operation of a new office machine which was not adequately explained to the person responsible for using it, causing considerable delay on the job. Discussion hinges on how this could have been avoided.

results.title: The Bright young newcomer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problem Series”.
One of a series of six films designed to help supervision and middle management improve human relations in the office. By failing to properly channel the initiative of the bright young newcomer, the supervisor is presented with an unpleasant ultimatum by his senior clerk. For the audience to discuss is the question as to what the supervisor could have done to avoid friction among the staff.
